item.title: Installing R, RStudio, and tidyverse
item.description: You will do all of your visualization work in this class with the open source (and free!) programming language R. You will use RStudio as the main program to access R. Think of R as an engine and RStudio as a car dashboard—R handles all the calculations and the actual statistics, while RStudio provides a nice interface for running R code. RStudio.cloud R is free, but it can sometimes be a pain to install and configure.

item.title: Syllabus
item.description: Data rarely speaks for itself.⊕Instructor Ryan Wesslen TBD rwesslen@uncc.edu @ryanwesslen Office hours: TBD. Course Mondays January 9–April 30, 2019 6:00–8:50 PM Room 110M: Packard Place Slack By itself, the facts contained in raw data are difficult to understand, and in the absence of beauty and order, it is impossible to understand the truth that the data shows. In this class, you’ll learn how to use industry-standard graphic and data design techniques to create beautiful, understandable visualizations and uncover truth in data.
